title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 71.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 71.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As defined in this Part, the term savings institution means a
savings bank or savings and loan association; and the term subordinated debt
security means any unsecured note, bond, debenture, or other obligation or
security issued pursuant to section
234
(5-b)
or
382-b
(2)
of the Banking Law, but shall not mean
any note, bond, debenture, or other obligation or security subordinated to the
claims of depositors issued to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation of the

Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
71.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
